articles.headline: The El Paso Homecoming That Set Beto O’Rourke’s Star on the Rise
articles.snippet: With help from his family, Mr. O’Rourke transitioned from rootless former musician to start-up founder, civic leader and candidate.
articles.abstract: With help from his family, Mr. O’Rourke transitioned from rootless former musician to start-up founder, civic leader and candidate.
articles.lead_paragraph: EL PASO — Beto O’Rourke attracted the officers’ attention near the Texas-New Mexico state line, rocketing past them in a speeding Volvo, hustling to nowhere around 3 a.m.
articles.byline: By Stephanie Saul and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: Believing Him: For Trump, Sticking With Men Like Stephen Moore Is Nothing New
articles.snippet: A president with his own troubled history has shown disdain for accusations of harassment, assault or just plain sexism against men who proclaim their innocence.
articles.abstract: A president with his own troubled history has shown disdain for accusations of harassment, assault or just plain sexism against men who proclaim their innocence.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Stephen Moore, President Trump’s preferred choice for the Federal Reserve, has written that women should not serve in the military or serve beer at men’s basketball games — unless they look like his favorite female ESPN commentator and dress in halter tops. He has scraped through a messy divorce, failing to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars in alimony and child support to his ex-wife.
articles.byline: By Annie Karni and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Stung by Trump’s Trade Wars, Wisconsin’s Milk Farmers Face Extinction
articles.snippet: The flagship industry in a pivotal swing state faces an economic crisis.
articles.abstract: The flagship industry in a pivotal swing state faces an economic crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: KENDALL, Wis. — For decades, Denise and Tom Murray rose before 5 a.m. and shuffled through mud and snow to milk cows on the farm that has been in their family since 1939. This month, after years of falling milk prices and mounting debt, the Murrays sold their last milk cow, taking pictures while holding back tears as the final one was loaded onto a truck and taken away.

articles.headline: Chasing Growth, a Women’s Health Start-Up Cut Corners
articles.snippet: Nurx, an online prescribing app, drew attention with its pitch about female empowerment. Former employees said it took a laissez-faire approach to women’s health.
articles.abstract: Nurx, an online prescribing app, drew attention with its pitch about female empowerment. Former employees said it took a laissez-faire approach to women’s health.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Matt Cronin worked in customer service at Nurx, a San Francisco start-up that sells prescription drugs online, one of his jobs was to manage the office’s inventory of birth control pills.
articles.byline: By Tess Riski, Natasha Singer and Katie Thomas

articles.headline: Elon Musk and S.E.C. Reach New Accord, Lifting Cloud Over Tesla
articles.snippet: Securities regulators and the chief executive of Tesla came up with a new agreement about when Mr. Musk’s social media posts must be reviewed by a lawyer.
articles.abstract: Securities regulators and the chief executive of Tesla came up with a new agreement about when Mr. Musk’s social media posts must be reviewed by a lawyer.
articles.lead_paragraph: If it was not already clear, securities regulators are giving Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, a laundry list of things he cannot riff about on Twitter.

articles.headline: Insurgents Seek to Oust Wayne LaPierre in N.R.A. Power Struggle
articles.snippet: A rift between Mr. LaPierre, the chief executive, and Oliver North, the president, threatened to turn the N.R.A.’s annual convention into outright civil war.
articles.abstract: A rift between Mr. LaPierre, the chief executive, and Oliver North, the president, threatened to turn the N.R.A.’s annual convention into outright civil war.
articles.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — Turmoil racking the National Rifle Association is threatening to turn the group’s annual convention into outright civil war, as insurgents maneuver to oust Wayne LaPierre, the foremost voice of the American gun rights movement.

articles.headline: Errors Raise Questions About Sri Lankan Response to Bombing
articles.snippet: A series of failures in preventing and investigating the Easter bombing has exposed rifts in the government and brought accusations of incompetence.
articles.abstract: A series of failures in preventing and investigating the Easter bombing has exposed rifts in the government and brought accusations of incompetence.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka — Time after time, Sri Lankan authorities have botched the effort first to head off and then to investigate the Easter Sunday terrorist attack that killed more than 250 people.
articles.byline: By Mujib Mashal, Dharisha Bastians and Jeffrey Gettleman

articles.headline: How China’s ‘Unicorns’ Shook a Bicycle Town
articles.snippet: Bike-sharing start-ups brought prosperity to Wangqingtuo. Now residents are dealing with the mess they left behind.
articles.abstract: Bike-sharing start-ups brought prosperity to Wangqingtuo. Now residents are dealing with the mess they left behind.
articles.lead_paragraph: WANGQINGTUO, China — This farm grows bikes, by the looks of it. Hundreds of blue and mint-green bicycles stand in rows on this field in Wangqingtuo, the small community that calls itself “bicycle town.” Only the occasional caretaker and a pen of bleating goats watch over them as they rust.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Cao Li

articles.headline: Apple Cracks Down on Apps That Fight iPhone Addiction
articles.snippet: Last year, with much fanfare, the tech giant unveiled a screen-time tracker of its own. Then it quietly began purging competitors from its store.
articles.abstract: Last year, with much fanfare, the tech giant unveiled a screen-time tracker of its own. Then it quietly began purging competitors from its store.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — They all tell a similar story: They ran apps that helped people limit the time they and their children spent on iPhones. Then Apple created its own screen-time tracker. And then Apple made staying in business very, very difficult.

articles.headline: Guantánamo Bay as Nursing Home: Military Envisions Hospice Care as Terrorism Suspects Age
articles.snippet: With no sign that the prison will close, the Pentagon has begun planning for detainees to grow old and die at Guantánamo Bay.
articles.abstract: With no sign that the prison will close, the Pentagon has begun planning for detainees to grow old and die at Guantánamo Bay.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was produced in partnership with the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting.

articles.headline: Two Super-Rich Families Ended Up on Opposite Sides of Easter Attacks
articles.snippet: In an instant, five of their children were blown to pieces in the Sri Lanka bombings, one family slaughtered by the other.
articles.abstract: In an instant, five of their children were blown to pieces in the Sri Lanka bombings, one family slaughtered by the other.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka — A little before 9 a.m. on Easter Sunday, Anders Holch Povlsen, the richest man in Denmark, was having breakfast with his family at the Table One restaurant in the Shangri-La Hotel in Sri Lanka’s capital, Colombo.
articles.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman, Kai Schultz, Mujib Mashal and Russell Goldman

articles.headline: Biden and Obama’s ‘Odd Couple’ Relationship Aged Into Family Ties
articles.snippet: Four years ago, Barack Obama gently discouraged him from running for president, but Joseph R. Biden Jr. is back and presenting himself as Mr. Obama’s natural heir.
articles.abstract: Four years ago, Barack Obama gently discouraged him from running for president, but Joseph R. Biden Jr. is back and presenting himself as Mr. Obama’s natural heir.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Barack Obama did not think Joseph R. Biden Jr. should run for president — he hardly needed to say it out loud for aides to understand that. The trick that summer of 2015 was finding a way to nudge Mr. Biden to stay out of the race without looking as if he was nudging Mr. Biden to stay out of the race.

articles.headline: In Pennsylvania, Joe Biden Finds Support Where He Most Needs It
articles.snippet: Despite doubts about his candidacy, Joe Biden begins the race with substantial support from three key constituencies in his native state, a place the Democrats can’t afford to lose again.
articles.abstract: Despite doubts about his candidacy, Joe Biden begins the race with substantial support from three key constituencies in his native state, a place the Democrats can’t afford to lose again.
articles.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH — The case for Joseph R. Biden Jr. has always come down to Pennsylvania.

articles.headline: Barr Threatens Not to Testify Before House, but Democrats May Subpoena Him
articles.snippet: The House Judiciary Committee was planning to question Attorney General William P. Barr on Thursday. But he objects to the panel’s proposed format for questioning.
articles.abstract: The House Judiciary Committee was planning to question Attorney General William P. Barr on Thursday. But he objects to the panel’s proposed format for questioning.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The powerful chairman of the House Judiciary Committee threatened on Sunday to subpoena Attorney General William P. Barr if Mr. Barr refuses to testify this week, a move that could lead to a major escalation of the long-running feud between the White House and congressional Democrats over testimony and access to documents.

articles.headline: Sri Lanka Attacks: Hometown of Accused Mastermind Was Fertile Ground for Extremism
articles.snippet: The influences of Wahhabism, a hard-line strain of Islam, transformed the hometown of the suspected ringleader in the Easter Bombings.
articles.abstract: The influences of Wahhabism, a hard-line strain of Islam, transformed the hometown of the suspected ringleader in the Easter Bombings.
articles.lead_paragraph: KATTANKUDY, Sri Lanka — When the Wahhabis came, with their austere ideology and abundant coffers, the town of Kattankudy yielded fertile ground.

articles.headline: Which Tech Company Is Uber Most Like? Its Answer May Surprise You
articles.snippet: It’s not Lyft or Didi Chuxing or another ride-hailing firm. Instead, Uber sees itself as the Amazon of transportation.
articles.abstract: It’s not Lyft or Didi Chuxing or another ride-hailing firm. Instead, Uber sees itself as the Amazon of transportation.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Pop quiz: Which technology company does Uber, the ride-hailing giant on the cusp of an initial public offering, consider itself to be the most like?

articles.headline: Synagogue Shooting Keeps Religious Leaders on Edge: ‘No One Should Be Gunned Down in Worship’
articles.snippet: An attack in Poway, Calif., was the latest reminder of a new reality that rabbis, imams and pastors must now take measures to prepare for the horrors of mass shootings.
articles.abstract: An attack in Poway, Calif., was the latest reminder of a new reality that rabbis, imams and pastors must now take measures to prepare for the horrors of mass shootings.
articles.lead_paragraph: POWAY, Calif. — The rabbi had just finished comforting a congregant as she prepared to say the traditional prayer for the dead in honor of her mother when a loud crack rang out in his synagogue.
articles.byline: By Louis Keene, Jennifer Medina and Elizabeth Dias

articles.headline: Syrian Refugees Toil on Turkey’s Hazelnut Farms With Little to Show for It
articles.snippet: On farms that produce 70 percent of the world’s hazelnuts for Nestlé, Godiva and Nutella, Syrians say they can’t earn a living wage — or much respect.
articles.abstract: On farms that produce 70 percent of the world’s hazelnuts for Nestlé, Godiva and Nutella, Syrians say they can’t earn a living wage — or much respect.
articles.lead_paragraph: AKCAKALE, Turkey — Like thousands of other Syrian refugees, Shakar Rudani worked last summer in Turkey’s Black Sea region, home to the largest concentration of hazelnut farms in the world. He arrived in August, expecting that he and his six sons, ages 18 to 24, would earn the equivalent of a few thousand dollars. He left in late September with little more than a firm resolution: to never return again.

articles.headline: Profitable Giants Like Amazon Pay $0 in Corporate Taxes. Some Voters Are Sick of It.
articles.snippet: In Ohio, where companies like FirstEnergy and Goodyear pay no federal corporate taxes, Democrats haven’t figured out how to leverage anxiety over income inequality to defeat President Trump.
articles.abstract: In Ohio, where companies like FirstEnergy and Goodyear pay no federal corporate taxes, Democrats haven’t figured out how to leverage anxiety over income inequality to defeat President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: AKRON, Ohio — Colin Robertson wonders why he pays federal taxes on the $18,000 a year he makes cleaning carpets, while the tech giant Amazon got a tax rebate.
articles.byline: By Stephanie Saul and Patricia Cohen

articles.headline: ‘996’ Is China’s Version of Hustle Culture. Tech Workers Are Sick of It.
articles.snippet: Chinese programmers once embraced working 9 a.m. to 9 p.m., six days a week. But online, discontent is brewing.
articles.abstract: Chinese programmers once embraced working 9 a.m. to 9 p.m., six days a week. But online, discontent is brewing.
articles.lead_paragraph: China’s richest internet moguls think their employees should work more.
articles.byline: By Lin Qiqing and Raymond Zhong
